cyclone.name: TAMMY
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest tonight, then north-northwest to north Saturday night through Monday, passing over the northern Leeward Islands and then moving northward east of Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands toward the western Atlantic.

weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Guadeloupe, Antigua, Barbuda, Montserrat, St. Kitts and Nevis.  Tropical Storm Warning: Dominica, Anguilla, St. Maarten/St. Martin/St. Barthelemy, Saba and St. Eustatius.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Lesser Antilles from Martinique northward through the Leeward Islands; swells and rain extending to the U.S. and British Virgin Islands and eastern Puerto Rico.
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (isolated maximum amounts up to 4 inches)
weather_observation.wind: 25 % chance of tropical-storm-force winds (34 kt+) with peak timing late Sunday into Monday; gusty squalls possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected; minor coastal water rise below 3 ft possible with larger swells.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could bring 1–2 inches with isolated totals near 4 inches, causing brief urban or flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough surf beginning this weekend.
